security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill describing a legitimate memory system. Static analyzer flagged 227 patterns, but all are false positives: the trauma guard safety examples were misidentified as dangerous commands, scoring terminology was confused with crypto, and documentation examples were flagged as executable code. No actual code or scripts are present.

content.user_title: Build persistent cross-agent memory with CM
content.value_statement: AI coding agents accumulate valuable knowledge but lose it between sessions. CM captures patterns and learnings across all your agents, turning scattered experiences into persistent procedural memory that improves over time with confidence scoring.
actual_capabilities: Extracts actionable rules and patterns from agent session logs
Shares knowledge between Claude, Codex, Cursor and other AI agents
Scores rule effectiveness with confidence decay over time
Prevents repeated mistakes with trauma guard safety system
Provides contextual guidance before starting coding tasks
limitations: Requires installation of separate CASS tool for session indexing
Needs API keys for LLM-powered reflection features
Cross-agent enrichment is opt-in for privacy
Performance depends on volume of session history

use_cases.target_user: Developers using multiple AI coding agents
use_cases.title: Share knowledge between agents
use_cases.description: When Cursor learns a debugging pattern, CM makes it available to Claude Code automatically.

use_cases.title: Build team playbook
use_cases.description: Convert individual agent experiences into shared team knowledge with proven patterns and anti-patterns.

use_cases.title: Personal coding memory
use_cases.description: Never forget how you solved tricky bugs. CM remembers successful patterns and warns about problematic approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Get context before coding
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new feature or bug fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Run cm context "implement user authentication with JWT" --json to get relevant patterns from your playbook

prompt_templates.title: Add team knowledge
prompt_templates.prompt: Use cm playbook add "Always validate JWT expiry before debugging auth errors" --category security

prompt_templates.title: Review recent learnings
prompt_templates.prompt: Run cm reflect --days 7 --json to see extracted patterns and provide feedback

prompt_templates.title: Prevent disasters
prompt_templates.prompt: Install trauma guard with cm guard --install to block commands matching harmful patterns

output: Relevant rules found: Always check token expiry before auth debugging (Score: 8.5/10)
Anti-patterns: Don't cache auth tokens without expiry validation
Similar sessions: 3 days ago - Fixed OAuth timeout in user service
Active trauma patterns: DROP TABLE (Severity: critical)
Blocked commands matching trauma patterns will show: BLOCKED: This command matches a trauma pattern

best_practices: Run cm context before starting non-trivial tasks to get relevant guidance
Leave inline feedback comments like // [cass: helpful b-8f3a2c] when rules help or hurt
Enable cross-agent enrichment only after reviewing privacy implications
anti_patterns: Don't manually add rules without evidence - let CM extract them from real sessions
Avoid sharing playbook files containing sensitive project information
Don't disable trauma guard without understanding why patterns were blocked

faq.question: Is my session data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. CM uses local-first design. All processing happens on your machine. Cross-agent enrichment is opt-in only.

faq.question: What agents does CM support?
faq.answer: Any agent producing session logs. Built-in support for Claude Code, Codex, Cursor, Aider, PI, Gemini, and ChatGPT.

faq.question: How does confidence decay work?
faq.answer: Rule confidence halves every 90 days without feedback. One harmful mark counts as 4 helpful marks. Rules progress from candidate to established to proven.

faq.question: Can I use CM without an LLM API key?
faq.answer: Yes. Set CASS_MEMORY_LLM=none for LLM-free mode. You'll get deterministic reflection without semantic enhancement.

faq.question: What happens if CM makes a mistake?
faq.answer: Use cm mark <rule-id> --harmful --reason or leave inline comments. CM learns from feedback and deprecates bad rules.

faq.question: How is CM different from searching session history?
faq.answer: CM extracts actionable rules, validates against history, tracks effectiveness over time, and shares knowledge across agents.
